dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think the vaccine race is all about speed, but actually it's a meticulous process with strict safety checkpoints.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think the vaccine race is all about speed, but actually it's a meticulous process with strict safety checkpoints.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Pfizer's CEO, Albert Bourla, just laid out their timeline for emergency approval.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Pfizer's C E O, Albert Bourla, just laid out their timeline for emergency approval.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer will apply to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for emergency approval of its Covid-19 vaccine in the third week of November, its CEO said Friday, assuming it receives positive results from its ongoing trial the timeline makes it unlikely that the U.S. will have a vaccine before the election but leaves open the possibility of one being authorized this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he said they're aiming to apply in the third week of November, assuming positive trial results.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he said they're aiming to apply in the third week of November, assuming positive trial results.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer will apply to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for emergency approval of its Covid-19 vaccine in the third week of November, its CEO said Friday, assuming it receives positive results from its ongoing trial the timeline makes it unlikely that the U.S. will have a vaccine before the election but leaves open the possibility of one being authorized this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, makes a pre-election vaccine pretty unlikely, despite what some politicians have been promising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, makes a pre-election vaccine pretty unlikely, despite what some politicians have been promising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer and other vaccine-makers have grown increasingly frustrated with the persistent politicization of potential Covid-19 vaccines by high-ranking officials, most notably President Trump, who has claimed one will be ready before the November 3 election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the FDA requires at least two months of safety data on half the trial participants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the F D A requires at least two months of safety data on half the trial participants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FDA requires at least two months of safety data on half of trial participants to grant emergency approval, he said, as well as information on effectiveness and proof it can be manufactured safely.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So that's really the bottleneck here—it's not just about proving it works, but proving it's safe over time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So that's really the bottleneck here-it's not just about proving it works, but proving it's safe over time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The safety data is likely to take the longest to collect Bourla said Pfizer expects to have manufacturing data before that and should know whether or not the vaccine is effective by the end of October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're working with BioNTech on this, which is a key partnership in the global effort.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're working with BioNTech on this, which is a key partnership in the global effort.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bourlas statement cements Pfizers status as a frontrunner alongside Germanys BioNTech, who it is developing the vaccine with in the global race to develop a safe and effective Covid-19 vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—no other manufacturer outside of Russia and China has gotten regulatory approval yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-no other manufacturer outside of Russia and China has gotten regulatory approval yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Excluding Russia and China, which have licensed vaccines for domestic use, no manufacturer has been granted regulatory approval for a vaccine anywhere in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so if Pfizer sticks to this schedule, they could be the first in many countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so if Pfizer sticks to this schedule, they could be the first in many countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Pfizer manages to stick to this timeline, it could be the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But you know, Bourla seemed kinda frustrated with the politicization of the whole process.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you know, Bourla seemed kinda frustrated with the politicization of the whole process.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer and other vaccine-makers have grown increasingly frustrated with the persistent politicization of potential Covid-19 vaccines by high-ranking officials, most notably President Trump, who has claimed one will be ready before the November 3 election. Bourlas letter does little to hide this annoyance,stating: To ensure public trust and clear up a great deal of confusion, I believe it is essential for the public to understand our estimated timelines for each of these three areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh for sure, especially with President Trump pushing for a lot sooner.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh for sure, especially with President Trump pushing for a lot sooner.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer and other vaccine-makers have grown increasingly frustrated with the persistent politicization of potential Covid-19 vaccines by high-ranking officials, most notably President Trump, who has claimed one will be ready before the November 3 election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, they're still planning to monitor safety data for two years after approval—that's a long-term commitment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, they're still planning to monitor safety data for two years after approval-that's a long-term commitment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company will continue to monitor and report safety data for all trial participants for two years, Bourla said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a balance between urgency and thoroughness, and honestly, uh, they seem to be erring on the side of caution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a balance between urgency and thoroughness, and honestly, uh, they seem to be erring on the side of caution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is what you want from a company handling something this important.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is what you want from a company handling something this important.

artist_script:
HostA: People think the vaccine race is all about speed, but actually it's a meticulous process with strict safety checkpoints.
HostB: Right, and Pfizer's CEO, Albert Bourla, just laid out their timeline for emergency approval.
HostA: Yeah, he said they're aiming to apply in the third week of November, assuming positive trial results.
HostB: Which, um, makes a pre-election vaccine pretty unlikely, despite what some politicians have been promising.
HostA: Exactly. And the FDA requires at least two months of safety data on half the trial participants.
HostB: So that's really the bottleneck here—it's not just about proving it works, but proving it's safe over time.
HostA: And they're working with BioNTech on this, which is a key partnership in the global effort.
HostB: It's interesting though—no other manufacturer outside of Russia and China has gotten regulatory approval yet.
HostA: Right, so if Pfizer sticks to this schedule, they could be the first in many countries.
HostB: But you know, Bourla seemed kinda frustrated with the politicization of the whole process.
HostA: Oh for sure, especially with President Trump pushing for a lot sooner.
HostB: I mean, they’re still planning to monitor safety data for two years after approval—that’s a long-term commitment.
HostA: It’s a balance between urgency and thoroughness, and honestly, uh, they seem to be erring on the side of caution.
HostB: Which is what you want from a company handling something this important.
